title: Easeout Weekly #15
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![AWS Lambda Logo](/images/uploads/aws-lambda.png) [Building Your First Serverless Service With AWS Lambda Functions](https://css-tricks.com/building-your-first-serverless-service-with-aws-lambda-functions/) A useful tutorial taking you through the process of building a serverless service with AWS Lambda functions. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/building-your-first-serverless-service-with-aws-lambda-functions/)
![Angular x pug author card](/images/uploads/angular-templates-pug.png) [How To Create Better Angular Templates With Pug](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/angular-templates-pug/) In this article, Zara Cooper explains what Pug is and how you can use it in your Angular app. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/angular-templates-pug/)
![Conic Gradients](/images/uploads/conic-gradients.png) [Background Patterns, Simplified by Conic Gradients](https://css-tricks.com/background-patterns-simplified-by-conic-gradients/) This articles takes some retro linear gradient patterns and shows us how we can simplify them with conic-gradient! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/background-patterns-simplified-by-conic-gradients/)
![Color on the Web](/images/uploads/color-on-the-web.png) [The Expanding Gamut of Color on the Web](https://css-tricks.com/the-expanding-gamut-of-color-on-the-web/) CSS colors are expanding at a time when screens support more colors than ever. This articles takes a look at why now is an exciting time for color nerds! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/the-expanding-gamut-of-color-on-the-web/)
![Linked Lists in JavaScript](/images/uploads/linked-lists-js.png) [Linked Lists for JavaScript Developers](https://daveceddia.com/linked-lists-javascript/) Data structures are the building blocks of the code we write every day. There aren’t that many resources for learning data structures *using JavaScript*, though. Dave Ceddia takes a look! [Read it ➡️](https://daveceddia.com/linked-lists-javascript/)
![Are You a Developer Venn Diagram](/images/uploads/venn-diagram.png) [Are You a Developer?](https://davidwalsh.name/are-you-a-developer) Let’s start by defining what a developer is. Ready for it? A developer is a person who writes code. That’s it! [Read it ➡️](https://davidwalsh.name/are-you-a-developer)
![Equivalent Experiences Example](/images/uploads/equivalent-experiences-kroger.png) [Equivalent Experiences: What Are They?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/equivalent-experiences-part1/) An equivalent experience is one that has been deliberately conceived of and built to be able to be used by the widest possible range of people. To create an equivalent experience, you must understand all the different ways people interact with technology, as well as common barriers they experience. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/equivalent-experiences-part1/)
![Responsive Image Graphic](/images/uploads/resp-images-thumb.png) [A Guide to the Responsive Images Syntax in HTML](https://css-tricks.com/a-guide-to-the-responsive-images-syntax-in-html/) This guide is about the HTML syntax for responsive images (and a little bit of CSS for good measure). We’ll go over srcset plus a whole bunch of things to consider to help you get the best performance and design control from your images. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/a-guide-to-the-responsive-images-syntax-in-html/)
![Structured Data Example](/images/uploads/structured-data.png) [Using Structured Data to Enhance Search Engine Optimization](https://css-tricks.com/using-structured-data-to-enhance-search-engine-optimization/) A neat primer into structured data. It’s used all over the web and, much like meta tags, is an invisible layer of information that search engines use to read the content. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/using-structured-data-to-enhance-search-engine-optimization/)
![Axios In Nuxt Starter](/images/uploads/axios-nuxt.png) [Getting Started With Axios In Nuxt](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/getting-started-axios-nuxt/) This tutorial shows us how to make a request in our Nuxt.js applications using the Axios module. We will also learn how to fetch data using Axios and the differences between the two methods. Finally, we will learn how to add authentication to our application using the Auth module. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/getting-started-axios-nuxt/)
![The Front-End Ceiling Podcast Card](/images/uploads/front-end-ceiling.png) [The Front-End Ceiling, Emacs, Permissions, and Writing Better Words](https://shoptalkshow.com/414/) Is there a way to control text in the prompt for user permissions? Have we tried Emacs? How do you write better words? When is it appropriate to add a new framework to your resume? Do you think there is a front end ceiling? [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/414/)
![Day Planner Example](/images/uploads/energized-homeoffice-image.png) [How To Feel More Energized Even When You’re Stuck At A Desk All Day](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/more-energized-stuck-at-desk-all-day/) Rather than feeling like your desk is a torture device, Suzanne Scacca shares some pointers for enjoying the time you spend there. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/more-energized-stuck-at-desk-all-day/)
![Block Links: The Search for a Perfect Solution](/images/uploads/cards-partial.png) [Block Links: The Search for a Perfect Solution](https://css-tricks.com/block-links-the-search-for-a-perfect-solution/) This articles looks at some accessibility considerations when working with block links. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/block-links-the-search-for-a-perfect-solution/)
![Tailwind Buttons](/images/uploads/reusable-react-components-button.png) [Building Reusable React Components Using Tailwind](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/reusable-react-components-tailwind/) This articles explores the ways to build reusable React components using Tailwind. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/reusable-react-components-tailwind/)
## Previous Issue: * [Easeout Weekly #14](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-05-23-easeout-weekly-14)
short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
